alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kit Carson County through 1130 PM MDT... At 1044 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Arriba, or 9 miles northwest of Flagler, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Kit Carson County. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 391 and 410. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
